intro: Galium tauricum, commonly known as the Tauric bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium tauricum is often found in regions with temperate climates and is known for its delicate, herbaceous appearance.
